label: 檜
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 52nd  . Nara National Museum . 2000
説明文: Japanese cypress (Chamaecyparis obtusa) .One of the most popular woods in Japan up to the present day. Hard and durable with an even grain, it is ideally suited to architecture, sculpture, and applied arts. In the Shōsō-in, hinoki can be found in offering tables, boxes, bentwood containers, and other objects.　[正倉院]
